Make sure your drills are attached to a HIGH mass object like a giant fuel tank / solar panels. Drills will produce heat and when they're attached to high mass objects, the high mass objects help to absorb a lot of that heat efficiently.

 

It was not attached to something high mass  / solar panels at the beginning but then can I dock a high mass object  / solar panels with the drill part? Will that help or is it still the same? Thanks! Engineer too. Can I dock one in different module later? Thanks a lot

Edited April 4, 2016 by Carrot

In general, trying to rely on conduction to cool off your drills (which is what you're describing) is not going to work very well, docking or no docking.  I doubt that simply attaching your drills to something massive to try to keep them cool will be very effective.

Docking another part would be even less effective, since to work as a heat sink, the heat would have to travel from the drill, to the part it's mounted to, through two docking ports, to another part.  That's going to have basically zero effect.

The way to keep your drills cool is to have radiators.  Specifically, you want the folding radiators, since those will pull heat from anywhere on your ship (they don't have to be close to the drills).  As long as you have enough radiators for the number of drills you have, you'll be fine.

And docking can help you there.    That is, if you have a ship with overheating drills, you can cool them off if you dock another ship to it that has folding radiators on it.  That'll solve your problem right there.

As far as engineers are concerned:  I don't think that engineers cause the drills to have less heat-- the engineer's skill level just acts as a bonus to boost the ore extraction rate.  So putting a higher-level engineer somewhere is always a plus.  The engineer can be anywhere you like, as long as it's connected to the drill somehow.  So, for example, if you have a ship with a high-level engineer in it and you dock it to the drill ship, then your drills will get faster.
